I made several enhancements to make the content more engaging, supportive, and aligned with Excel High School's instructional design principles:

1. Added encouraging language to the feedback section for incorrect answers, emphasizing growth mindset and providing reassurance for "second-chance" learners.

2. Reformatted the scenario explanations with bullet points to improve readability and clarity, especially helpful for visual learners and those who may struggle with dense text.

3. Added positive reinforcement ("Great job if you selected...") to build confidence, particularly important for adult learners and credit recovery students.

4. Added an "Application Tip" section at the end to emphasize the flexible, non-linear nature of the writing process, connecting the quiz content to real-world application.

5. Enhanced the overall tone to be more supportive and less clinical, addressing the needs of learners who may lack confidence in their academic abilities.

These changes support UDL principles by providing multiple means of representation and engagement while maintaining the core educational content.
